title: Euphrates
content: An important river that rises in the mountains of Armenia and falls into the Persian Gulf, frequently called in scripture “the River.” It provided a route of communication between east and west. It was the boundary of the land promised to the seed of Abraham (
); this boundary was reached in the time of David (
). The stronghold of Carchemish was built at the ford of the river and was a position of great importance in military operations (
). On the banks of the Euphrates stood the great city of Babylon.
